posts.text: This was the fourth attempt to throw 8kg of clay!

You have so many I have not read. I am off to make a huge amazon order!
150 reader

According to one luminary, there are only 150 books that you would reread. This seemed outrageous to me when I first heard the comment, but on consideration I realised that 150 might be too many. Books that I would reread? Easily 150 books that I might dip into again, but fully reread? Some of the following are guilty pleasures. Some I have found myself rereading after recommending them to my son. The Poetry Books are a dipping pleasure.

These are my first selection -

Three Men in a Boat -J K Jerome

The Gormenghast Trilogy – M Peake

The Jeeves Series – P J Wodehouse

Collected works of T S Elliot

Lord of the Rings – Tolkein

Lord of the Flies – W Golding

Just William Series – R Crompton

Collected Poems of Hilaire Belloc

Shakespear – plays and poems

The War of the Worlds – H G Wells

Animal Farm – G Orwell

The Thirty Nine Steps – J Buchan

Sherlock Holmes Series A C Doyle

Pride and Prejudice – J Austin

My Family and Other Animals – G Durrell

Hitch Hikers Guide to the Galaxy – D Adams

THe Hotel New Hampshire – J Irving

Earthsea Trilogy -U Le Guin

His Dark Materials – P Pullman

The Odyssey – Homer

Which would you choose? Going to look up the titles of all the other books I love.

A Reader of more than 150

Thinking now about what books I should reccommend for Thomas 14. His has such wierd reading lists from school. Either well beyond him – for the non ficton groups ( done by subject at the school) or from the English department a list of 10 books, again very mixed ability.

When you look at the lists for 14 year olds specifically it is better but still difficult to pick out one or two. In the end we have agreed that he should read – War of the Worlds, 39 Steps and a few chapters of Bad Science. An intersting choice by him.

All the books I read at his age, he has already read!
